data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3146764,"name":"Susan Clay","username":"susanclay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/46a35a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-16T16:42:20.303Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSay my motor is starting with an initial angle of 1 radian, and I want it to follow a trapezoidal motion profile to end with a final angle of 2 radians. I can call \u003ccode\u003etrapProfileSubsyst_.SetGoalState({units::radian_t{1}, units::radians_per_second_t{0}}); //desired goal distance is 1 away\u003c/code\u003e in my code to set a goal state of being 1 radian away, but the profiled positions start at zero. So, when I do \u003ccode\u003ePID.Calculate(motor_rads, goal_profile_rads)\u003c/code\u003e, my motor will turn the opposite way because \u003ccode\u003emotor_rads\u003c/code\u003e starts at 1 and \u003ccode\u003egoal_profile_rads\u003c/code\u003e (which I’m getting through the \u003ccode\u003eUseState\u003c/code\u003e function) starts at 0. I’ve seen that potentially one option may be to use the \u003ccode\u003eProfiledPIDController\u003c/code\u003e class, but if possible I like being able to have my motion profiling separate from my PID and feedforward objects. What should I do to solve this issue?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-16T16:42:20.303Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":193.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427051,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-wpilib-trapezoidalmotionsubsystem-when-starting-at-a-non-zero-position","display_username":"Susan Clay","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49990,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-wpilib-trapezoidalmotionsubsystem-when-starting-at-a-non-zero-position/427051/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3146769,"name":"Emile Hamwey","username":"EmileH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emileh/{size}/254137_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-16T16:45:12.349Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI believe you may need to call \u003ccode\u003ereset()\u003c/code\u003e on your PID controller.
